DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to use the BIS monitor to assess the degree of consciousness in pre-terminal palliative patients admitted to our palliative care unit and to ascertain if this tool provides a more accurate assessment of consciousness in this specific group of patients than clinical observation of consciousness and the use of sedation scales. We hypothesize that the measured BIS results provide a more accurate assessment of the patient's level of consciousness than routine clinical observation or the use of sedation scales.
DOC.brief_title: Measuring Depth of Unconsciousness at the End of Life Using Bispectral Index (BIS)
DOC.criteria: Preterminal palliative patients with a life expectancy of 72 hours or less at the start of the observation. lack of consent of patient or representative
